Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black figure decoration consisting of part of woman's head (hair painted black and partly fired red, traces of dots in added white on fillet, trace of white for flesh applied directly on clay and possible trace of added red on cloak below neck), to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see the women on British Museum 1888,0208.71.a from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.023) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
